channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A WFH ‘culture war’ has broken out across Europe, with the U.K. leading the charge as the most WFH-friendly country, while France lags behind
item.description: Where in Europe is WFH winning?

item.title: UK polls point to a massive win for Labour. The party doesn't want voters to think it's a done deal
item.description: Expectations have mounted that the Labour Party will win the U.K.'s upcoming snap election ever since Conservative Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called the vote.

item.title: Top banks have raced to up dividends after Fed stress tests — here’s how much
GE extends CEO Larry Culp’s contract through at least 2027 after successful turnaround—taking him out of the running to lead Boeing
item.description: Culp had been cited by analysts and others as a candidate to succeed Boeing’s Dave Calhoun, who has said he plans to step down by the end of the year.

item.title: Iran faces runoff election between reformist and ultra-conservative presidential candidates
item.description: Amid record-low voter turnout of around 40% in the election's first round Friday, two dramatically different candidates came out on top.

item.title: Hedge-fund billionaire Dalio now fears November clash between political extremes
GameStop investor drops pump-and-dump lawsuit against ‘Roaring Kitty’ just 3 days after filing it
item.description: In a court filing late Monday afternoon, Radev said he was voluntarily dismissing the lawsuit.

item.title: Gen Z is ditching dating apps to meet people in real life. Here are 4 top tips.
item.description: Tech-savvy Gen Zers are not experienced with interacting with people in real life. Two relationship experts offer tips on how to navigate the dating scene in person.

item.title: U.S. stocks on track to kick off year’s third quarter with gains — live coverage
Australians now need a prescription to buy a vape under new ‘world-leading’ law
item.description: The law restricts vape sales to pharmacies and will temporarily require a doctor’s prescription for the buyer.

item.title: Enough is enough: Japanese airlines clamp down on abusive travelers
item.description: Amid rising uncivility, Japan Airlines and All Nippon Airways outline the behaviors that constitute "customer harassment" of their staff members.

item.title: BlackRock agrees to acquire privately held U.K.-based Preqin for $3.2 billion
Butter prices jump to all-time high as more dairy producers shift to cheese while bird flu keeps U.S. output tight
item.description: Prices hit an average of $7,350 per metric ton on the latest Global Dairy Trade auction, surpassing a previous peak of $7,086 in 2022.

item.title: Chinese EV companies Zeekr and Nio report record deliveries in June
item.description: Chinese electric car company Zeekr delivered the most cars in the first half of the year among U.S.-listed Chinese companies only selling pure electric cars.

item.title: French stocks surge by most in nearly two years after first round of election
